{"step_by_step_thinking": "The usefulness of a screening test depends on several factors. Sensitivity refers to the test's ability to correctly identify those with the disease. Specificity refers to the test's ability to correctly identify those without the disease. Reliability refers to the consistency of the test results. Predictive value refers to the probability that a person who tests positive actually has the disease. All these factors are important in determining the usefulness of a screening test.", "answer_choice": "A. Sensitivity, B. Specificity, C. Reliability, D. Predictive value"}
